summary: This is an email chain discussing the technical progress of stamping and exporting a document production (likely SDNY_PROD015) in the US v. Epstein case. The sender provides updates on the completion status of multiple parts and mentions a plan to request an extension from Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge from whom an extension is being planned to be requested regarding the document production timeline.

events.title: Document Production Progress Update
events.description: An email update is provided on the stamping and exporting of a multi-part document production (SDNY_PROD015) for the US v. Epstein case, noting progress on parts 1-4 and a plan to request a deadline extension.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 5, 2020, concerning the US v. Epstein case.
It discusses the technical processing (stamping and exporting) of a document production labeled SDNY_PROD015, broken into seven parts.
Parts 1-3 of the production are reported as finished, with part 4 being stamped at the time of writing.
The sender mentions planning to ask Judge Nathan for an extension, but hopes the work may be completed sooner than the discussed November 19th date.
The email provides specific search queries (e.g., Q SDNY_PROD015 - PART 01) for reviewing the produced documents in a system (likely Relativity).
